description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4opuf","text":"Standard operation of the SpectraMax iD3 plate reader.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"em03u","text":"SpectraMax iD3 Multi-Mode Microplate Reader User Guide - Molecular Devices","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dturq","text":"The instrument can measure in 3 distinct modes: Absorbance, Luminescence or Fluorescence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8f2q","text":"--\u003e Fluorescence wavelength range: EX 250-830nm, EM 270-850nm. Plate sizes: 96 or 384 wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nvou","text":"--\u003e Luminescence wavelength range: 300-850nm or 300 - 650 nm for \"All Wavelengths\" setting. Plate sizes: 96 or 384 wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rtlf","text":"--\u003e Absorbance: 230 - 1000 nm. Plate sizes: 6, 12, 24, 48, 96, and 384-well plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9akqe","text":"There are reading types. available: Endpoint read type, Kinetic read type, Well Scan read type, and Spectrum read type. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er1k1","text":"Software: SoftMax version ....","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13ulu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30n48","text":"Prepare samples to be measured in proper plate and containing samples and standard curve as needed for each application and experimental design.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oqqi","text":"For reference refer to SpectraMax iD3 user guide and SoftMax User Guide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o0vi","text":"Use your lab User and password for computer login ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b63qb","text":"Open Data acquisition and analysis software Softmax Pro version 7.1.2. There are many personalized methods and analysis that can be edited and saved. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cke5r","text":"To use any pre-set protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"890q6","text":"Click Protocols -\u003e Protocol manager --\u003e Protocol Library --\u003e Choose a protocol and load.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qkmd","text":"or follow this general step-by-step to get samples measured and export data without creating a new protocol or using a pre-set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4vgr8","text":"Click open Softmax 7.1.2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2imgv","text":"Check instrument connection status -- should be connected with a green check. If showing disconnected: click on the instrument icon, the instrument connection dialog is displayed. In the available instrument list wait to display Offiline Spectra Max iD3, select Spectra Max iD3, click OK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qchd","text":"It should connect --\u003e for troubleshooting refer to Softmax Pro User Guide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6s4s1","text":"A general process for preparing, collecting, and analyzing data is as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b34a7","text":"Start the SoftMax Pro Software. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l33j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96nr1","text":"Select an instrument: Check instrument connection status --\u003e it should be connected with a green check. If showing disconnected: click on the instrument icon, the instrument connection dialog is displayed. In the available instrument list wait to display Offiline Spectra Max iD3, select Spectra Max iD3, click OK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b58c9","text":"It should connect --\u003e for troubleshooting refer to Softmax Pro User Guide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csnqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g0ri","text":"Choose a data acquisition protocol. You can use an existing protocol or create a new one.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ban25","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arp1h","text":" --\u003e To use an existing protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anvuk","text":"1. Click the Application button to open the Application menu.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o4nh","text":"2. Select Open. The Data Files file type is selected by default.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dudu","text":"3. Select a protocol file type from the list.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b2af","text":"SoftMax Pro Software 7 can open files created by version 4.0 or newer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2cdk","text":"When you open a file from a previous version, it is converted to SoftMax Pro Software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ahjf","text":"version 7 format.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96thh","text":"4. Navigate to the protocol file you want to open.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjmrp","text":"5. Select the file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ern92","text":"6. Click Open.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38dd6","text":"An untitled file opens in the workspace with the settings of the selected protocol applied to","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b391l","text":"it. Before using the protocol to collect data, save it as a data file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n9an","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a89ln","text":"--\u003e To set up a new protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs8d2","text":"Define the instrument settings to use with the protocol. To open the Settings dialog:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cea35","text":"1. Click Settings on the Home tab in the ribbon or in the toolbar at the top of the","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4nf1","text":"active section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qeki","text":"The available options in the Settings dialog  has two methods available for configuring a microplate read.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vhee","text":"The Standard View uses a table-like design, with selectable categories where you can","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21bda","text":"configure your settings. The Acquisition View uses a workflow design, with drag-and-drop tools to configure your settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akai0","text":"Select parameters for your application:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu619","text":"1- Read modes: ABS, FL or LUM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"135nb","text":"2- Read type: Endpoint, kinetic, well scan or spectrum","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mp25","text":"3- Categories: --\u003e type wavelengths --\u003e select the plate type applied to your measurement from the list --\u003e Read area: select specific wells or entire plate --\u003e Path check: uncheck--\u003e Shake: check and select specific settings (time in seconds, intensity, and shake mode) or leave empty if no shaking is needed before measurement --\u003e More settings: define read order row or columns-wise.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b1c6","text":"After defining the settings for the protocol, click OK to close the Settings dialog.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abq4c","text":"4- Click on the open door icon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3adp2","text":"5- Insert your plate, A1 position should be at the top left corner","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af7ph","text":"6- Click on the Read icon in the software --\u003e door will close automatically and measurements will start.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3cne","text":"7- Click the Open door icon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tmq4","text":"8- Remove plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55f8s","text":"9- Click the close door icon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k66l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c741e","text":"--\u003e To save and export the acquired data:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkhfc","text":"1-Click on home --\u003e save as --\u003e spd","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dis9b","text":"or","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"673pu","text":"2- Click on home --\u003e export --\u003e plate --\u003e txt or xls--\u003e choose folder location --\u003e save","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93fuq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crd82","text":"Close Softmax Pro software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mfrt","text":"Log out from your user","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck182","text":"Leave computer on","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: BAF_S05_Plate Reader SpectraMax iD3
